messages.message: I discussed with observability team, here is the best practice to build/test grafana dashboard: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01DJ7QDC2H/p1736577772101189?thread_ts=1736539143.547429&cid=C01DJ7QDC2H
Aside: It would be great to get observability services included in the crafting sandbox. I for one like to use Jaeger to debug perf problems locally, but I have to set that up manually.

@sudeep If you are around, if we can make the observability services come up cleanly with `make build-docker run-docker -C <service-dir>` on a laptop, then we can pretty easily add them to the sandbox.
I did not see this thread, Ligao and I chatted on the thread that he linked there

> Aside: It would be great to get observability services included in the crafting sandbox. I for one like to use Jaeger to debug perf problems locally, but I have to set that up manually. (edited)
@mfichman i think this will be a bit a more involved, i brought this up to @Kerry this week as well for something we should prioritize in next quarter. The actual service startup is easy, however the configs will take more work. A lot of observability setup is based on k8s primitives for service/target discovery (or log collection etc). So this will be something that will need a bit of heavy lift, and something we will look into prioritizing in Q1.
